messages.subject: Re: Unschoolers next door (was Alex)
messages.msgSnippet: I got forty five acres in NC Montana for sale. It has a seven bedroom three bathroom house.. NO UNSCHOOLERS But great house, Great property.. LET ME
messages.messageBody:
I got forty five acres in NC Montana for sale. It has a seven bedroom
three bathroom house..


NO UNSCHOOLERS>

But great house, Great property..


LET ME KNOW:::LOL

Kathleen

my sister is fixing to move to knoxville from tx. i've never been to TN or NC ; hopefully i will get to visit both this summer. i've always wanted to take a trip to asheville. wish i could go to the live and learn conf. too. mich

Ren Allen <starsuncloud@...> wrote:
~~ Is that East TN then? ~~

About as far East as you can go, up here in the mountains. We're an
hour from Asheville, an hour from Abingdon and an hour and a half from
Knoxville. Perfect.:) Do you know about the TNUnschooling list?
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/TNunschooling/

~~
We'll do it if you can get them to legalize same-sex marriage in that
time.Get to work on that, will ya? ;)~~

I would love to see that happen. You know who TN voted for on Super
Tuesday right? argh. There are plenty of liberals around these parts
though. This could take some time....;)

~~Next door to Ren would be
lovely, but I'd rather be across the street on that beautiful piece of
property. I need acres, baby! Each time we move, I up the anty. ;)~~

Funny thing...I was just sitting on my couch sipping tea this morning
and staring out at that huge chunk of land, wondering what it would go
for per acre! DReaming large....

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: Unschoolers next door (was Alex)
messages.msgSnippet: Is that East TN then?  I live in Memphis and am really interested in meeting some unschoolers if any of you are around here.  My oldest will be 5 this year and
messages.messageBody:
Is that East TN then? I live in Memphis and am really interested in meeting
some unschoolers if any of you are around here. My oldest will be 5 this
year and we're trying to figure out what we're going to do. I don't want to
send him to school here but I'm not quite in a position to stay home or have
DH stay at home. We're working on selling our old house to make that a
possibility but with this market who knows when that will be. There are
four kids here and right now one of them is in school (not one of mine) and
the next two oldest will be school age this Fall. We still have time with
my youngest to make that decision.

Mirika


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Alex
messages.msgSnippet: That would be lovely. Let me know when is a good time and we will come. Alex Julie Hiniker  wrote: What is Life is Good? BTW Alex we
messages.messageBody:
That would be lovely. Let me know when is a good time and we will come.
Alex

Julie Hiniker <momx12@...> wrote:
What is Life is Good?

BTW Alex we should be in the midst of lambing by the end of March- early April want me to notify you so the little ones can come see a baby or two. We have a small flock but they almost always have twins. They are born with cute curly hair.

I think my children are getting spring fever.. the girls started looking at patterns to make new clothes last night and going through their material stash, the boys went outside yesterday even when it was 5 below windchill.

Julie
mom to the darlin' dozen.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Alex
messages.msgSnippet: And we are counting the day to have them..... Love, Alex ENSEMBLE S-WAYNFORTH  wrote: My mom lives in Mankato, she and her husband
messages.messageBody:
And we are counting the day to have them.....
Love,
Alex

ENSEMBLE S-WAYNFORTH <s.waynforth@...> wrote:
My mom lives in Mankato, she and her husband love, love, love the Farmer's Market, does your daughter sell her wares there? As soon as I saw your name I thought of Hiniker Pond. Last summer Simon and Linnaea went fishing and swimming in Hiniker pond every day while we were visiting. It is a far cry from their UK experience with ponds.

Go to Alex's when you get a chance. It is a lovely place, and they are a lovely family. We'll be stopping by on our way from Life is Good this summer to see her and Gigi and MD and Brian.

Schuyler
www.waynforth.blogspot.com

----- Original Message ----
From: Julie Hiniker <momx12@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, 12 February, 2008 3:15:54 AM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Alex

Alex,
Happy Birthday!!!
What laptop? I just got the Acer they had/have on sale.I love it.
We are on a hobby farm. My daughter raises icelandic sheep for the wool and meat. A couple of my girls spin.
We also have chickens and horses and dogs and cats and rabbits.........

I would love to meet you guys! What are the ages of your children?
Life is pretty hectic right now between my mom and getting her set up with some hospice help, hopefully before dh and I take off to our sons commencement from Warrant Officer USArmy training. (he has already been commisioned!) and a new grandbaby due next week and my own intense morning sickness. but hey other than lets get together soon!

Does it count if we are just getting into the whole unschooling thing? Can we be half of what you asked for for now anyway? LOL!
btw if we want to talk offlist I am momx12 at hickorytech.net
Julie

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Alex
messages.msgSnippet: ... I ve been to Ren s place, and she lives in a beautiful part of the country. Lovely rural setting, good growing season, with a really cool, funky little
messages.messageBody:
Jodi Bezzola wrote:
>
> Know absolutely zilch about Tenessee, but since it's likely warmer
> than Calgary, and you're pretty cool too, I'm in! :o)
>

I've been to Ren's place, and she lives in a beautiful part of the
country. Lovely rural setting, good growing season, with a really cool,
funky little town with a gorgeous main street, and not too far from
Asheville and other happenin' Southern places. Next door to Ren would be
lovely, but I'd rather be across the street on that beautiful piece of
property. I need acres, baby! Each time we move, I up the anty. ;)

--
~~Danielle
Emily (10), Julia (9), Sam (7)
http://www.organiclearning.blogspot.com

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

Connections: ezine of unschooling and mindful parenting
http://connections.organiclearning.org

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Alex
messages.msgSnippet: ... www.Lifeisgoodconference.com It s a PNW regional spin-off of the Live and Learn Conference , started by our very own
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 12, 2008 5:01 AM, Julie Hiniker <momx12@...> wrote:

> What is Life is Good?
>
>



www.Lifeisgoodconference.com
It's a PNW regional spin-off of the Live and Learn
Conference<http://liveandlearnconference.org>,
started by our very own Kelly Lovejoy :D
Same format and principles apply. The same weekend as LiG, there is the NE
Unschooling Conference
<http://www.northeastunschoolingconference.com/>(also based on Kelly's
amazing model!!)
Being in the middle of the country, you've got LOTS of pickins for
conferences, just as soon as you're up for one.
--
~diana :)
xoxoxoxo
hannahbearski.blogspot.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Alex
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Julie, Sounds wonderful!! My kids are young. My ds is only 5 and a half and dd just turned 2. We are not young or we would have more. I just turned 42 and
messages.messageBody:
Hey Julie,
Sounds wonderful!! My kids are young. My ds is only 5 and a half and dd just turned 2.
We are not young or we would have more. I just turned 42 and dh is 45. We started late.
We have Holsteins, and we do a lot of genetic work and show them also. We also have dogs ( I used to show dogs), Guinea pigs, cats and a Gold Fish.
I would love to see your sheep!!!!!!!
My dh just left Best Buy in Mankato and got me that Gateway ( red one)
that was on sale this weekend. We needed a red one since it is my ds's favorite color<G>.
My 2 y o dd is a farm crazy girl. She loves to do chores with daddy. Here is a couple of video's I made on YouTube:

http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=oywTTgskxZM

http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=OGxR52VcrU8
Hope to meet you soon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Alex ( so excited about another unschooling family near by!)
PS I have a neighbour that homeschools and has 16 kids and her name is Julie!!!!!!

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Alex
messages.msgSnippet: I am just 8 miles SouthWest outside  Rochester. We are Dairy Farmers. My dh is not a big talker ( can relate to your dh)  but it might do good for  your dh to
messages.messageBody:
I am just 8 miles SouthWest outside Rochester. We are Dairy Farmers. My dh is not a big talker ( can relate to your dh) but it might do good for your dh to know another Dad that unschools that he can relate to.
By the way Dh is driving to Mankato tonight to buy me a Laptop ( my birthday was yesterday) that was on sale at BestBuy but they are out over here!!!!!!!!
Maybe you all can come visit my farm when it warms and they can meet then.
I would love to meet you and your family one way or another!
Alex

Julie Hiniker <momx12@...> wrote:
Alex,
We are near Mankato and while I sure appreciate the offer my dh still looks haunted when he remembers my friend's dh who spoke to him about his Christian walk! Pat is one of those very laid back, think about it and slowly digest it kind of steady guys.. Makes for a fantastic marriage but it has taught me more about patience than having 12 children has!
Where are you in MN.
Julie
mom to the darlin' dozen.(Hoping we will be changing this to the bakers dozen in about 7 months!) Grandma to Paul and Ryne and soon to be born Peyten!

Alex,
We are near Mankato and while I sure appreciate the offer my dh still looks haunted when he remembers my friend's dh who spoke to him about his Christian walk! Pat is one of those very laid back, think about it and slowly digest it kind of steady guys.. Makes for a fantastic marriage but it has taught me more about patience than having 12 children has!
Where are you in MN.
Julie
mom to the darlin' dozen.(Hoping we will be changing this to the bakers dozen in about 7 months!) Grandma to Paul and Ryne and soon to be born Peyten!

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Thanks Melissa
messages.msgSnippet: Julie, Where do you live??We are in MN and my dh is still a farm boy raised in a strick family like your and I mbet my dh could talk to yours . My dh embraces
messages.messageBody:
Julie, Where do you live??We are in MN and my dh is still a farm boy raised in a strick family like your and I mbet my dh could talk to yours . My dh embraces RU all the way!!
Alex



















Julie Hiniker <momx12@...> wrote:
Melissa,
Thanks for the email and I enjoyed checking out your blog. My dh and I talked more and he is very open to unschooling or whole life learning etc. as a MN farm boy raised in a large strict family he is a little less open to the ideas of RU and was shocked when I pointed out several things he already does that are inline with the whole thing just as a natural extension of wanting to do things differently than the way his parents did.
A close friend who I have been co-oping with and had many great discussions about unschooling and the possibilities inherent in it ,however, was almost horrified that I was actually going throe with it. She really thought this was just a short season we are trying on while my mom is dying and that I'd keep writing curriculum with her. I will finish what we are doing together because other people want it and three of my children want to do this study which is why I started to write it in the first place - they are having so much fun writing it with me it will be a success even if we never do a day of the study.
Julie
mom to the darlin' dozen.(Hoping we will be changing this to the bakers dozen in about 7 months!) Grandma to Paul and Ryne and soon to be born Peyten!

messages.subject: Thanks Melissa
messages.msgSnippet: Melissa, Thanks for the email and I enjoyed checking out your blog. My dh and I talked more and he is very open to unschooling or whole life learning etc. as a
messages.messageBody:
Melissa,
Thanks for the email and I enjoyed checking out your blog. My dh and I talked more and he is very open to unschooling or whole life learning etc. as a MN farm boy raised in a large strict family he is a little less open to the ideas of RU and was shocked when I pointed out several things he already does that are inline with the whole thing just as a natural extension of wanting to do things differently than the way his parents did.
A close friend who I have been co-oping with and had many great discussions about unschooling and the possibilities inherent in it ,however, was almost horrified that I was actually going throe with it. She really thought this was just a short season we are trying on while my mom is dying and that I'd keep writing curriculum with her. I will finish what we are doing together because other people want it and three of my children want to do this study which is why I started to write it in the first place - they are having so much fun writing it with me it will be a success even if we never do a day of the study.
Julie
mom to the darlin' dozen.(Hoping we will be changing this to the bakers dozen in about 7 months!) Grandma to Paul and Ryne and soon to be born Peyten!
